pullRequest.body:
These are exactly `div_le_one_of_le` with `a / b` replaced by `a * b‚Åª¬π` and `b‚Åª¬π * a`.

They come up frequently because some tactics produce inverses as normal forms over division.  The iff versions with `0 < b` already exist as `mul_inv_le_one_iff` and `inv_mul_le_one_iff`; the point of these is to have a weaker nonnegativity assumption on `b`.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Possibly I should add `inv_mul_le_one_of_le` too?
Yes, and iff versions assuming `0 < b`. Also please edit the PR title, I cannot comprehend it üòÑ

Is that title better?

I'll add the inv_mul version now.  The iff versions already exist: [mul inv](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Group/Defs.html#mul_inv_le_one_iff), [inv mul](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Group/Defs.html#inv_mul_le_one_iff).
Now that's better!
@YaelDillies: Would you be up for a review and approval if it seems reasonable?
What‚Äôs the next step after ‚Äúmaintainer merge‚Äù?
Nothing on your part. A maintainer will merge the PR or come up with a comment I hadn't thought of.

Thanks! :tada:
bors merge

maintainer merge

Those docstrings read like "Here's the reason I made a PR", which is not very useful on declarations in Lean code. They would fit better in your PR description
```suggestion
lemma mul_inv_le_one_of_le (h : a ‚â§ b) (hb : 0 ‚â§ b) : a * b‚Åª¬π ‚â§ 1 := by
  simpa only [‚Üê div_eq_mul_inv] using div_le_one_of_le h hb

```
